title: Laurence Arthur DeMatteo
text:
Deltona - Laurence (Larry) DeMatteo passed away on December 21, 2023 in Orange City, Florida.
The son of Arthur and Beatrice (McNulty) DeMatteo, he was born December 28, 1936 in Hyde Park, MA and was raised in Bradford.
He and his late wife Barbara raised their family in Danvers before moving to Deltona, FL in 1986. He worked as a sheet metal mechanic for Local #17 in Boston, as well as at the Portsmouth, NH and Orlando and Jacksonville, FL naval bases. He was known for his love of all things train-related and belonged to several live steam and rail enthusiast groups.
He was pre-deceased by his wife of 61 years, Barbara (Fudge) DeMatteo and his sister Gayle (DeMatteo) Morris. He is survived by his children, Jeanne (Robert) Goggin of Jacksonville, FL and Cheryl (James) Tibaudo of North Andover as well as grandchilren, Adam Goggin, Douglas (Samantha) Tibaudo, Michael (Marguerite) Tibaudo and great-grandchildren, Isla, James, Elise and Elizabeth.
Interment will be private at a future date.

Plant a tree: How does it work
When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.
An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.
After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.
Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.
Tree Planting Timeline
Orders placed in:
January - May
Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.
June - December
Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
